content.description:
Super fun, but with a tricky landing zone. 

  Sit start, and pull out. Getting up the bottom of the face is the crux.  

  Top out is sort of a highball, but easy.
content.location: Down and climber's right from the giant boulder in the middle of the scree field

content.description:
On the climber's right downslope side of the massive boulder in the middle of the scree field, you'll find this fun arete problem.  

  Begins with a sit start underneath the boulder, then you have to clamber out and up.  

  2 cruxes, the start then the top out. Easy climbing between.  

  Super fun. Quality.
content.protection: 2 pads if you're doing the lower. 4+ if you're going for the full highball.
content.location: Up the middle of the scree field to the massive boulder. The obvious arete on the climber's right side / the north eastern corner.

content.description:
An upward slanting crack that moves left. 

  Delicate footwork marks the top out. Make sure you have plenty of pads.
content.location: Down and climber's left from the coffin.

content.description:
Hard. Big reaches, tough body positions. 

  Start inside with a sit start, work your way out the long way, and pull the roof.
content.location: Directly climber's left of the base of the giant boulder in the middle of the scree.

content.description:
East facing, the sun only hits here in the mornings. It's a beautiful place though, with a majestic view. 

  The rock is granite with large crystals, and mostly solid. The scree field however isn't, be very careful of what you're standing on, and watch out for holes or moving rocks.
